definition: Foreign Minister
outside/in addition/foreign/external
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang

sentences.english: Japan's new foreign minister sworn in .
sentences.chinese: 日本新外相松本剛明宣誓就職。

sentences.english: British Foreign Secretary Jack Straw called the charges "inaccurate".
sentences.chinese: 英國外相斯特勞稱這是不準確的指責。

sentences.english: And Japanese former(foreign) minister Taro Aso said mister Abe may visit China as early as October.
sentences.chinese: 日本外相麻生太郎稱安倍會在十月初訪問中國。

sentences.english: Former Vice Foreign Minister Hitoshi Tanaka is among those who have lost patience with him.
sentences.chinese: 前副外相田中仁是對菅直人首相失去耐性的人之一。

sentences.english: He was foreign minister under both Mr Koizumi and Mr Abe.
sentences.chinese: 他在小泉和福田兩屆內閣裏擔任外相。

sentences.english: Seiji Maehara, the new foreign minister in Mr Kan's government, is on the party's realist wing.
sentences.chinese: 菅直人政府的外相前原誠司是民主黨內現實派的代表。

definition: foreign ministry (e.g. of Japan or Korea)

foreign affairs

Kyōdō, Japanese news agency
prime minister (of Japan or UK etc)
secretary-general
foreign minister/secretary of state/minister of foreign affairs
summit talks/discussion between heads of state

Abe (Japanese surname)
minister of finance
